intro: Parrya huddelliana, commonly known as the Huddell's parrya, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Parrya huddelliana is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
